txt.en: There is a bag of horse-feed near the refugee waiting at the end of the line on the bridge trying to get into Gapholt.\n\nYou should collect horse-feed from the bag.
Many horses are agitated by the wait on the bridge after the long journey from Woodhurst.\n\nThe refugee at the end of the line suggested that you feed them to help calm them down.

The horses seem more calm now that you have given them a little food, and it seems they are less likely to become unruly and cause injury to themselves or others. Hopefully, whatever is delaying their entry will be resolved soon.
The horses are now much less agitated thanks to your efforts.
Gapholt has become a haven for the Rohirrim who sought a safer place to live than the dangerous streets of Woodhurst.
A Long Journey for the Steeds

'We need to ensure these horses stay calm. They all had a long journey here from Woodhurst and now grow restless waiting up on this bridge. I could use your aid, for I must keep my place in this line.\n\n'Please gather some of the horse-feed from the bag at the end of the line and give a little to each horse. Hopefully, that will ease their spirits.'
